content: I checked the schedule for the History Channel for tomorrow. I was saddened but not surprised to find out that the scheduled programming for Memorial Day is a marathon of Monster Quest. If not even the History Channel recognizes what tomorrow is it is any surprise that many people just see it as a day off and an excuse to grill.
reply: I checked the schedule for the History Channel for tomorrow. I was saddened but not surprised to find out that the scheduled programming for Memorial Day is a marathon of Monster Quest. title: History Channel on Memorial Day

content: Almost didnt believe it so I checked myself and sure enough.. Monster quest.. what a lame show. They never, ever find what they are looking for. And theres always some idiot on there that either claims or believes in some impossible scenario. Funny how in this 21st century world of pocket digital cameras and camera phones, no one ever takes pictures of the bullcrap they claim to have witnessed. Anyway, highly disappointed in history channel's programming choice for tomorrow. I actually planned to tune in about lunch time to see if there were any good WW2 programs on. Looks like thats a negative.

content: The History Channel has really gone downhill in recent years. It used to have running programs on WWII, the Nazis, all sorts of great stuff. I fail to see what "Ax Men", "Ice Road Truckers", and "Monster Quest" have to do with history.
